feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 7:01PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Significant Snow Tonight Through Friday Night... A low pressure system over Southcentral Alaska will move north over the Central Alaska Range tonight, and then move east across the Interior Friday and Friday night. This will bring a significant amount of snow to the Interior south and east of Fairbanks tonight through Friday night. Snow will taper off by Saturday
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:11PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf South of the Bering Strait... Southwest winds will produce elevated surf 1 to 2 feet above the normal high tide line through Saturday morning. With the wave action and elevated water levels low lying areas may have water move into them. Residents should ensure possessions are well above the normal
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued October 20 at 1:59PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT DUE TO ELEVATED PARTICULATE MATTER LEVELS FROM WINDBLOWN DUST... The Imperial County APCD has issued an air quality alert due to increased particulate matter from blowing dust. The air quality alert is in effect for Saturday. In areas directly impacted by high levels of windblown dust, limit
entry.cap:areaDesc: Imperial County Southwest; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley

entry.title: Red Flag Warning issued October 20 at 7:49PM MDT until October 21 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FRIDAY... .Gusty west winds will combine with renewed very dry conditions to result in critical fire weather Friday afternoon for the high valleys, foothills and far northern plains. The highest fire danger will be found in the northern foothills and adjacent lower elevations, where the strongest winds are expected.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FIRST SIGNIFICANT SNOW OF THE SEASON LIKELY FOR THE MOUNTAINS THIS WEEKEND... Significant changes are on the way for the much of the western Colorado mountains as well as the Eastern Uintas as a strong cold front moves across the region this weekend. Moisture across the region will increase to near 200% of normal for late October. The
entry.cap:areaDesc: Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Southwest San Juan Mountains; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:47PM EDT until October 22 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Cocoa 9w affecting Brevard County. .The forecast point near Cocoa is within Minor Flood stage and is forecast to continue a slow decline and may fall below flood stage by this weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Brevard

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:46PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point at Sanford is forecast to remain in Major Flood stage through the end of this week and into this weekend while slowly declining. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:43PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. For the Peace...including Bartow...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Polk

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:41PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Deland will remain within Major Flood stage through the weekend and into early next week while slowly declining. Interests along the river should expect these major flood impacts to continue.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:39PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood. Despite a slow decline, the river level will remain in Major Flood stage through the weekend and into early next week. Interests along the river will continue to see major flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 20 at 9:37PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.cap:areaDesc: Bollinger; Butler; Cape Girardeau; Carter; Mississippi; New Madrid; Perry; Ripley; Scott; Stoddard; Wayne
